channel.title: [jQuery] Change html contents while sliding down
channel.description:
I'm making a see more button like on facebook, and I want one final effect.
When you load the page you see a shortened version of the comment, then when you click See More it changes the contents of the element to include the entire comment. Basically, this: [code] $(commentElement).html( entireComment ).slideDown('fast'); [/code]
Obviously, just adding slideDown to the end doesn't actually do anything because the element is already showing. I just want the element to expand with the slide down effect when it adds the new content, instead of just expanding instantly.

item.title: [jQuery] Change html contents while sliding down
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

you could also link the posts in a graph and have a button at the bottom of the page expand the div and load x new node items

Read full topic

item.title: [jQuery] Change html contents while sliding down
item.dc:creator: @cruel cruel
item.description:
@cruel wrote:

The easiest way is to put the remainder of the content in a nested or inline

and slide that down.

Example:

[code]<div id="content>

stuff
and more stuff !
Click Here for full content.
[/code] Then you'd put in jQuery to hide #linkdiv and slidedown the #fullcontent (which starts out hidden). Naturally, you wouldn't have exactly a clean expansion with dynamic content [b]with just this code[/b] since some content may not be cleanly cut into a convenient candidate for partial content. But with decent parsing, you could wrap any content technically into these containers.

Read full topic
item.source: [jQuery] Change html contents while sliding down

item.title: [jQuery] Change html contents while sliding down
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

[quote=“oldschool, post:4, topic:345771”]thats easy, same effect, but don’t pull down the whole comment.

use a .load() to call in the rest of the text you want to display, after the user clicks the button to expand ;D.[/quote]I want it to expand with the slide effect.

Read full topic

item.title: [jQuery] Change html contents while sliding down
item.dc:creator: @oldschool oldschool
item.description:
@oldschool wrote:

thats easy, same effect, but don’t pull down the whole comment.

use a .load() to call in the rest of the text you want to display, after the user clicks the button to expand ;D.

I can quickly hide the element, then slide it down but there’s a pause between hiding and showing it, and it looks a bit strange…
